intro: Scholtzia oligandra, commonly known as the narrowleaf scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Scholtzia oligandra is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
